Author: Markus#5464
Content: The part about NN mining big blocks well im not very surprised. If a system will allow u to do something like mining easier than others then obviously ppl will try to do their very best to exploit anything what would bring them more money

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if we didnt create a hunting pool, then i estimated 10+ NN would end up hunting instead of steady mining and that is not good

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: yeah, the big block mining 'exploit' doesnt surprise me and i dont blame some people for using it, its good that it got changed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with the hunting pool, it makes no sense for any NN to be a dedicated hunter as it is negative expected ROI

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: because the team donates 90% of hunted funds to the rest of the NN

Content: its possible, but we just did a hardfork

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: productivity will be back as soon as this dead subject dead again.

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: markus i think the solution already in place is bettr than that, it splits the rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it takes literally a couple months to get all the nodes updated and doing annual hardfork seems the practical, unless it is some sort of horrible attack. which this isnt

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, the hunting pool is now setup to encourage teamwork. the better all the notaries do (best performing vs worst performing) the higher the payout

Author: Markus#5464
Content: üëç

Content: sorry for brinigng up the issue grewal, NNs dealt with this already but us in the public just heard of it now lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we turned an otherwise messy situation into the best outcome that we could come up with. now it rewards financially all the NN for helping each other do better

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: It was a headache catching up with that convo üò¶

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Ye indeed, im sorry too for talking about this we dont need negativity üëç

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we didnt make any public announcing of this as it is an internal NN matter and also it just got put in place in the last month

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i never forbade people from talking about it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not my fault nobody mentioned it before today

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: some people feel that my decision that 75% of blocks should get 75% of revenues is very controversial, but i felt it wasnt really any big issue that i needed to immediately make some sort of public announcement about

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the data is being publicly displayed on the notary stats websites, for anybody who wanted to follow such matters

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, i found that nothing you can do will make some people stop posting, the best seems to just ignore it and this was a very stressful topic especially consiering the timing. i didnt really feel motivated to go out of my way to explain it all over again

Author: Markus#5464
Content: How did u come up with 75%? Just trying to understand the thinking of the decision, was there any other options to consider?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i prefered to come up with some new tech, like nspv

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 75% is what the NN are currently mining via the easy mining

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it has been that way for over a year

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Lets say KMD price goes to 100$ one day, will NN still mine 75% or will it get adjusted?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: based on the consensus code, the NN could actually be mining 95%, but we are intentionally mining less so the external miners could get 25%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but one of the external miners started sniping and NN ended up with significantly less than 75%

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: lol, so THATS how it started, an external miner caught on üòÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at higher KMD prices, we can indeed change the 75% down but not less than 50%

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Alright

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, until the external miner started sniping, there was peace in the land

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once that happened, it destablised things, so we responded with the hunting pool

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: NNs were just peacefully exploiting the loophope all to themselves, until one day...

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: üòÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: NN were intentionally mining only 75% instead of 95% that they could

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: ah

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and randomly NN would get big blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and statisically if you get 75% of blocks, you expect 75% of total

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: starting end of last year, it stated being significantly less

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we then identified a specific miner that was sniping the big blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once we found that out, we solved why 75% of blocks wasnt getting anywhere near the 75% of total

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we worked on a solution and now are able to get much close to 75%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: THAT is the apparent controversy

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: well, keep creating tech.  maybe the market will eventually care, and not just dump everything for the original shitcoin that cant scale and has almost full blocks üòõ

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: the thing is yeah, people can say it s just anger. This is not just anger. A decentralized organisation can t keep doing centralised stuff. I m ok being seen as a bad person again.  But the thing is that all of this should have been public far sooner. The point of that is that wether people admit or not, to be healthy and improve itself, an ecosystem need multiple type of people and minds. Revealing issues is key to improvement, but it s the ability to address them and fix before we come to a situation where after monthes nothing has been done.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: yes it s pretty hard to admit things, but it s the path to reconsider own choices, and find ways to improve, neglecting it is neglecting the fact that it was done to improve the system. Agility is key, and being too slow is not good. This space goes very fast, so the ability to fix is also a key to success

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: When I told James I wanted to break pride and ivory tower, that meant being able to consider different opinions that may or may not help to move forward, and again, improve

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Can t prove anything without some facts. Unfortunately after monthes of saying stuff people didn t understand, this was the only way to get credibility. This must just evolve

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: like KomodoWorld said, things must just change for the good of the ecosystem
